data.title: Great in Britain: the movie
data.meta_description: Great in Britain: The Movie.  Cult comedy movie.  British independent film.  Musical comedy.  The story of three old friends and a dog called, Audrey.
data.text:
2024 PRIVACY POLICY

This website is owned by Factory Film Productions Ltd

To contact us in relation to our privacy policy and data protection you can:

1. Use our online contact form on this website

2. email us at info@greatinbritainmovie.com

Please clearly state that it is a 'Privacy Policy Query' in your communication.

Cookie Notification

Cookies (small text files) are placed on your device (computer, tablet or smart phone). You are asked permission for this to be done. After you have agreed and a cookie added to your device the cookie will track your use of the website. This information can be used to compile data based reports on your usage of the website. You will be given an option to decline a cookie being placed on your device. You can also preset your browser preferences to accept or decline cookies. You can also remove cookies from your device after visiting a website, or alternatively you can pre-set a browser to accept or decline cookies when visiting a website. In this regards you will need to review the browser you are using and consult the relevant official guides in relation to that browser and its functionality in this regards. It is worth noting that declining cookies can in some cases impact the use of a website and a websiteâ€™s functionalities and impact your user experience.

What information/data we keep on you if you get in contact with us

If you get in touch with us (phone, online form, email, post a letter or even in person) we will keep a record of the information that is supplied (this could include name, phone number, email address, postal address). This is a necessary and legitimate business activity so that we can effectively operate as a commercial business. It also allows us to effectively respond to any general questions and business requests.

Keeping you data secure

Factory Film Productions Ltd makes all reasonable efforts to ensure your data is kept safe and secure and to prevent unauthorised access or use or loss of your data. Despite this, the use of the internet as a method of communication is never 100% secure. Because of this it is impossible to guarantee that information sent to us using the internet will be completely secure. Use of the internet as a communications tool is at your own risk.

Third party websites Our website has links to 3rd party websites. If you use these link and leave our website we are not responsible for the protection of any information which you provide whilst visiting these sites. We do not have control over 3rd party websites. We would suggest that if concerned about a 3rd party website that you review its privacy policy.

Sharing data

None of your personal data is passed to a 3rd party for the purposes of marketing. Should we wish to do this we will seek your consent. We will, when necessary, share data with 3rd parties only when it is a legitimate part of our business activity. It is expected that these 3rd parties comply legally in respect to data confidentiality and security.

These third parties are, but are not limited to:

Our professional service providers, partner companies that support the business activity of the licensing and distribution of the film to exhibitors and premiere screening events (activities here include the monitoring of ticket sales, the invoicing, collection and processing of licence payments and minimum guarantee payments, the duplication and the physical delivery of screening discs and promotional material to exhibitors and premiere screening events). Other third parties including exhibitors (and exhibitor organisations), our website hosts and our professional advisors.

Credit reference agencies, law enforcement and fraud prevention agencies

Social media sites where you have chosen to link your accounts to one of our social media accounts.

NB. If we are legally obliged to share your data to third party organisations (like law enforcement) then we shall comply with the law.

Storage of your data - how long? Generally we will store your data for as long as it takes to deal with a query or a request. Beyond this we may still need to keep hold of your data if there is a legal or financial reason for doing so. This could relate to, but is not limited to, an ongoing legal or financial dispute. In these circumstances we will retain the data necessary to deal with these matters. If none of the above applies and if we have had no active questions, queries or commercial requests from you in the last year, then we will remove any personally identifiable information from your data after the industry standard period of time.

GDPR

You have various rights under GDPR which allow you to:

ask us for a copy of the personal data we hold about you

correct or update your personal data (you would need to contact us with updated information)

request that we delete your personal data

object to the handling of your personal data

restrict the processing of your personal data

request the transfer of your personal data (or some of it) to a third-party service provider; or

where you have provided your consent for something, in certain circumstances, you may withdraw this consent (but note that we may continue to use your personal data if we have legal grounds for doing so).
